title: 108_hr647
content: The Act is titled the "Canceling Loans to Allow School Systems to Attract Classroom Teachers Act." It provides additional qualified loan amounts for student loan forgiveness and loan cancellation. The "Canceling Loans to Allow School Systems to Attract Classroom Teachers Act" amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to increase loan repayment amounts for teachers, with priority given to special education teachers supporting children with disabilities. The "Canceling Loans to Allow School Systems to Attract Classroom Teachers Act" amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to increase loan repayment amounts for teachers, with priority given to special education teachers supporting children with disabilities who are certified and have demonstrated knowledge and teaching skills in the relevant content areas. The "Canceling Loans to Allow School Systems to Attract Classroom Teachers Act" amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to increase loan repayment amounts for teachers, with priority given to special education teachers supporting children with disabilities who are certified and have demonstrated knowledge and teaching skills in the relevant content areas. The Act also authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2003 and beyond to carry out the provisions. The Secretary will cancel loan obligations for teachers meeting requirements on a first-come first-served basis, giving priority to special education teachers supporting children with disabilities. The Secretary will cancel loan obligations for teachers who are teaching children with disabilities or are teachers of mathematics or science in underperforming schools. Authorization of Appropriations: Such sums as may be necessary are authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2003 and the 4 succeeding fiscal years.
